column4: damn, if msoffice2007 install via wine I got another 350gb hd to play with on this laptop. =)
don't count on it.. however :).... you can run windows in virtualbox from inside of ubuntu for those "must have" apps..
yes.. get virtual box from their site..
you can't run an already install version of windows in a vm.. you have to install it in the vm
what do you do in office that absolutely needs ms office?
graphics work and a little spreadsheets?
yea.. and office 2003 & 2000 also do the same thing.. how 'bout installing OpenOffice on the work machine and you'd be set in both worlds?

having worked in both worlds I know what you're up against.. OOo draw is better for layout then the wordprocessor but won't translate.. scribus is a great desktop publishing program and works on both platforms .. but.. it's tough teaching something new and if there are others (didn't know that).. it makes it that much more difficult.

it's a full desktop publishing program.. you can do magazines, newspapers, flyers menus, business cards etc.. with print ready PDF output in cmyk etc.. there's even a book on amazon for it.. it takes a while to get use to but is really fantastic.. also their irc at #scribus is very helpful.. most times I end up talking to the author.
yep.. a good companion program for creating svg graphics etc is inkscape
there's usually two versions in the repos.. one ending in -ng .. -ng is typically the more recent version
they also have a repo for ubuntu to get the absolute latest.. sometimes it's worth it..
no.. use synaptic or scribus' repos ... it is a mental shift to use scribus.. don't expect to do things like in a word processor or MS Publisher.. it's different..

I think that after using it for a while you'll get hooked.. remember that when creating a text box you can right mouse click on it and "edit text" .. you can also F2 afterwards for more adjustment options.
no you don't have to do that.. it's just an option.
now you're getting the hang of it :)
have fun and spread the joy :)
